scenario:
CPP, a mission-driven affordable housing preservation developer, has acquired Ramona Park, an affordable housing complex in Baldwin Park, California, for approximately $23.3 million. The property will undergo significant renovations, including interior and exterior upgrades, at a cost of approximately $3.75 million. The total development investment is around $27 million.

The renovations will address long-overdue maintenance needs, enhance accessibility, and introduce new amenities such as a picnic area, bike racks, and surveillance cameras. The property's affordability will be renewed for 20 years through a Section-8 Housing Assistance Payment (HAP) contract, with all units restricted to family households earning 30%, 40%, 50%, and 60% of the Area Median Income (AMI).

CPP is partnering with LifeSTEPS to provide on-site services to residents, including adult education, health and wellness, and skill-building classes. The project is being financed through a combination of construction financing from US Bank and a permanent loan from Capital One, using a Freddie Mac product. The California Tax Credit Allocation Committee (CTCAC) has issued and allocated 9% LIHTC, and WNC & Associates serves as the equity partner.
